result.markdown:
---
title: Setting up
---


## RStudio Cloud

If you choose to use RStudio Cloud, you do not need to install anything on your computer. You can simply log in to RStudio Cloud and follow along with the workshop. **Join our shared space by clicking the button below**:

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Join%20Shared%20Space-RStudio%20Cloud-yellow?style=for-the-badge&logo=appveyor)]()


## Binder

Want to play around with `dataharvester` without an RStudio Cloud account? Launch our Binder instance by clicking on the button below. Binder should only be used in a test environment as Binder instances are not persistent and will be deleted after a period of inactivity.

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Launch%20Workshop-Binder-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=appveyor)]()

## RStudio Desktop

::: callout-important
RStudio Desktop users must know how to debug issues with their R installation. If you are not sure, please use RStudio Cloud instead. 
:::

Pushing ahead with a local setup? Great! Please follow the instructions below. **We advise you to do this before the workshop so that you can debug early and focus on the content.**


<details>
  <summary>**Step 1**: Get R and RStudio up to date</summary>

  Install/update R and RStudio to the latest versions: [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) | [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

</details>

<details>
  <summary>**Step 1**: Get R and RStudio up to date</summary>

  Install/update R and RStudio to the latest versions: [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) | [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

</details>

<details>
  <summary>**Step 1**: Get R and RStudio up to date</summary>

  Install/update R and RStudio to the latest versions: [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) | [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

</details>

<details>
  <summary>**Step 1**: Get R and RStudio up to date</summary>

  Install/update R and RStudio to the latest versions: [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) | [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

</details>


<!-- 1. Install/update R and RStudio to the latest versions: [R](https://cran.r-project.org/) | [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

2. Install the [`dataharvester`](https://github.com/Sydney-Informatics-Hub/dataharvester) package from GitHub using the `remotes` package.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("sydney-informatics-hub/dataharvester")
```
:::


3. Load the `dataharvester` package. This step may take a few minutes to complete while Python dependencies are installed and validated.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dataharvester)
initialise_harvester()
```
:::


4. To use Google Earth Engine, you will need to create a Google account and obtain an API key. Edit the function above:


initialise_harvester(earthengine = TRUE)
``` -->
